tasks.task: Conduct research on the integration of cover crops and manure for soil health and corn yield.
subtasks: Planting cover crops in late summer/early fall.
Applying liquid dairy manure in early or late fall via sweep injection.
Measuring cover crop biomass in late fall.
Analyzing nutrient source effects on cover crop biomass.
Examining the impact of cover crop planting techniques (broadcasting vs. drilling) and timing.
Evaluating corn yield affected by manure application and cover crops.
Comparing spring-applied urea vs. fall-applied manure for nutrient rates.
Observing the effect of cover crops on silage yield.
Acknowledging USDA NRCS Conservation Innovation Grants.
Recognizing Minnesota Quorum Research and Promotion Council support.
Gratitude to the Foundation for Food and Agriculture Research.

tasks.task: Demonstrating research methods and poster content.
